definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: More students like having ice-cream, ice lollies and soft drinks after school.
sentences.chinese: 大多數學生課後愛喫冰淇淋，冰棍和軟飲料。

sentences.english: How a woman suggestively licking a lolly could face a sex harassment case.
sentences.chinese: 女性辦公室舔冰棍是性騷擾。

sentences.english: Ice pops are good on hot days but may not be good on a cold day.
sentences.chinese: 冰棍熱天很棒，但冷天就可能不那麼好了。

sentences.english: Forthcoming month classics when how does violent campaign eat ice- lolly to drink cold water to meet?
sentences.chinese: 來月經的時候狂運動喫冰棍喝涼水會怎麼樣？

sentences.english: I also ate a sesame ice-cream.
sentences.chinese: 我還喫過一根帶黑芝麻的冰棍。

sentences.english: My family likes to play soccer or kickball. Play freeze tag.
sentences.chinese: 我家喜歡玩橄欖球或踢球，玩“冰棍化了”遊戲。

sentences.english: This is the "old Popsicle" is like?
How do you feel about popsicles?

definition: sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
